definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Piracy is alive and flourishing on the world's commercial sea-lanes.
sentences.chinese: 海盜行爲在世界各地的商運航線上很猖獗。

sentences.english: It's in front of the main entrance of the domestic airport lounge.
sentences.chinese: 在國內航線候機室的正入口前面。

sentences.english: Strong cross-winds blew the aircraft off course.
sentences.chinese: 強勁的側風把飛機吹得偏離了航線。

sentences.english: And the simulations of the minimum fuel route are conducted over the North Pacific Ocean in winter.
sentences.chinese: 並針對冬季北太平洋進行了最省燃料航線模擬試驗。

sentences.english: With the formation of industrial clusters, inland cities will be encouraged to open international passenger and cargo air routes, and develop multimodal transportation.
sentences.chinese: 支持內陸城市增開國際客貨運航線，發展多式聯運。

sentences.english: It is learned that Tianjin has more than 30 air exclusive implementation of the route .
sentences.chinese: 據瞭解，目前天津航空擁有30餘條獨家執行的航線。

sentences.english: During the summer, in Nanchang, Guangzhou, China Eastern Airlines to open a route flights.
sentences.chinese: 暑運期間，東航在南昌廣州航線增開了一個往返航班。

sentences.english: The latter is the largest order placed by any Scandinavian airline.
sentences.chinese: 後者是任一斯堪的納維亞定期航線的最大定單。

sentences.english: Shipping companies are ready to explore new routes.
sentences.chinese: 航運公司已作好了探索新航線的準備。

sentences.english: So you can imagine what the gas bill would be on a transcontinental flight.
sentences.chinese: 所以你也能想象得出橫貫大陸的航線需要多少汽油錢。

sentences.english: Many planes and tows were blown far off course.
sentences.chinese: 許多飛機以及拖曳物皆被吹離航線。

sentences.english: After Chongqing opened the port, "modern agitation " poured into Sichuan Basin along the course of the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 重慶開埠後，“近代風潮”沿長江航線湧進四川盆地。

sentences.english: The national carrier says it plans to reestablish routes to Europe next year.
sentences.chinese: 這家國營航空公司說，計劃明年恢復飛歐洲的航線。

sentences.english: Come onto course 115, " Lron roared to Rem."
sentences.chinese: “轉到115航線上去，”勒榮對雷咆哮着。

sentences.english: The captain plotted out the ship's course and told the crew to get ready.
sentences.chinese: 船長標示出船的航線並讓船員們做好準備。

sentences.english: The paper studies the feasibility of developing high speed passenger transport in Fuzhou Xiamen shipping line.
sentences.chinese: 對福廈航線開展水上高速客運的可行性作了分析。

definition: to open up (windows for air, ideas for discussion, transportation routes etc)
running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
China Airlines (Taiwan)/abbr. for 中華航空公司|中华航空公司[Zhong1 hua2 Hang2 kong1 Gong1 si1]
to go nonstop to/through (as in "through train")/nonstop
